1.text: The words of king Lamuel. The vision by which his mother instructed him:

2.text: “What, O my beloved? What, O beloved of my womb? What, O beloved of my vows?

3.text: Do not give your substance to women, or your riches to overthrow kings.

4.text: Not to kings, O Lamuel, not to kings give wine. For there are no secrets where drunkenness reigns.

5.text: And perhaps they may drink and forget judgments, and alter the case of the sons of the poor.

6.text: Give strong drink to the grieving, and wine to those who are bitter in soul.

7.text: Let them drink, and forget their needs, and remember their sorrow no more.

8.text: Open your mouth for the mute and for all the cases of the sons who are passing through.

9.text: Open your mouth, declare what is just, and do justice to the indigent and the poor.

10.text: Who shall find a strong woman? Far away, and from the furthest parts, is her price.

11.text: The heart of her husband confides in her, and he will not be deprived of spoils.

12.text: She will repay him with good, and not evil, all the days of her life.

13.text: She has sought wool and flax, and she has worked these by the counsel of her hands.

14.text: She has become like a merchant’s ship, bringing her bread from far away.

15.text: And she has risen in the night, and given a prey to her household, and provisions to her maids.

16.text: She has considered a field and bought it. From the fruit of her own hands, she has planted a vineyard.

17.text: She has wrapped her waist with fortitude, and she has strengthened her arm.

18.text: She has tasted and seen that her tasks are good; her lamp shall not be extinguished at night.

19.text: She has put her hand to strong things, and her fingers have taken hold of the spindle.

20.text: She has opened her hand to the needy, and she has extended her hands to the poor.

21.text: She shall not fear, in the cold of snow, for her household. For all those of her household have been clothed two-fold.

22.text: She has made embroidered clothing for herself. Fine linen and purple is her garment.

23.text: Her husband is noble at the gates, when he sits among the senators of the land.

24.text: She has made finely woven cloth and sold it, and she has delivered a waistband to the Canaanite.

25.text: Strength and elegance are her clothing, and she will laugh in the final days.

26.text: She has opened her mouth to wisdom, and the law of clemency is on her tongue.

27.text: She has considered the paths of her household, and she has not eaten her bread in idleness.

28.text: Her sons rose up and predicted great happiness; her husband rose up and praised her.

29.text: Many daughters have gathered together riches; you have surpassed them all.

30.text: Charm is false, and beauty is vain. The woman who fears the Lord, the same shall be praised.

31.text: Give to her from the fruit of her own hands. And let her works praise her at the gates.
